definition: to send out/to show (one's feeling)/to issue/to develop/to make a bundle of money/classifier for gunshots (rounds)

sentences.english: The landscape will get more cluttered, the air and water even dirtier.
sentences.chinese: 景色会变得更加杂乱，空气和水也会变得愈发肮脏。

sentences.english: Today the business environment is more petitive and fast-changing than ever.
sentences.chinese: 现今的商业环境，竞争愈发剧烈，变革弹指之间。

sentences.english: The music becomes unmusical and the motions become less coordinated.
sentences.chinese: 音乐变得缺乏音乐性，而动作也变得愈发不协调。

sentences.english: For this reason, they believed in Fei Changfang even more firmly than before.
sentences.chinese: 这样一来，他们愈发相信起费长房的话来。

sentences.english: In v. 12 Paul spoke of many expressions of thanks to God.
sentences.chinese: 保罗在第12节指出，许多人会愈发感谢神。

sentences.english: And in the night to become cool, to lady finds out the thin quilt.
sentences.chinese: 而且夜晚愈发的凉了，给婆婆找出了薄棉被。

sentences.english: While the springs to the stream of Daming Lake, nature also become more and more beautiful.
sentences.chinese: 而众泉归流的大明湖，自然也愈发的美丽了。

sentences.english: Linton is visibly more ill and hardly has the energy to meet her.
sentences.chinese: 小林顿看上去病情愈发严重，几乎没有去见她的力气。

sentences.english: State-owned media Xinhua reported late-last year that the trend was rising.The U.
sentences.chinese: 国营媒体新华社去年底报道这一倾向正愈发明显。

sentences.english: At that point they increasingly start to eat seabirds, as well as other mice.
sentences.chinese: 这时，他们愈发吃起海鸟以及其它老鼠。

sentences.english: It's growing harder and harder to concentrate.
The faster-moving and more competitive the environment, the more important innovation is.
sentences.chinese: 环境的节奏越快，竞争越激烈，创新就愈发显得重要。

sentences.english: The higher cost of overbooking means airlines will be more conservative.
sentences.chinese: 超额预订的成本上升意味着航空公司会愈发保守。

sentences.english: Raising rates would make the struggle even worse.
sentences.chinese: 提高利率会使这场争斗愈发恶化。

sentences.english: The more I travel, the more I have seen how beautiful this world is.
sentences.chinese: 随着我不断旅行，我愈发发现这个世界是如此的美丽。

sentences.english: This type of error will increase in the last days before Christ returns.
sentences.chinese: 这类错谬的行径，在基督再来之前的末世会愈发加增。

definition: increasingly/more and more/ever more/all the more
to progress (or increase, change etc) day by day/more (or better etc) with each passing day
day by day/more and more/increasingly/more and more with each passing day
(increasing) day by day/(more critical) with every passing day/gradually
to become more and more/to gradually become
